duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform safe, proper and humane care of assigned animals according to established protocols or under the direction of the appropriate senior wild animal keeper and /or the supervisory/curatorial staff.
Prepare animal diets according to established protocols or under the direction of the appropriate senior wild animal keeper and/or the supervisory/curatorial staff.
Assist in developing safe, proper and humane protocols for the management and maintenance of the animal collection, exhibits, and holding facilities.
Inspect animal exhibits, holding facilities, and associated service areas to ensure they are clean, well lit, properly ventilated, and report any deficiencies or required maintenance.
Submit daily reports summarizing events/changes in the animal collection and staff activities, identifying required maintenance, and listing needed supplies and equipment.
Aid the general public and provide information concerning the zoo, visitor services, exhibits, and the animal collection.
Enforce the zoo's visitor rules and regulations.
Perform other related tasks and duties at the instruction of senior animal keepers and/or the supervisory/curatorial staff.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree with major in Biology or a related field with three years recent, full-time paid experience in handling, feeding, and care of animals in a zoo or on a stock farm with experience supervising animal care staff OR an equivalent combination of education or experience.
